com.cognifide.slice.api.injector

Interface InjectorsRepository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InjectorsRepositoryService

    @ProviderType
public interface InjectorsRepository

    Helper class to get Injector instances. Slice supports multiple injectors installed on a single Sling/AEM instance, with each injector being tagged with name of the application that created it. By default, the application name is the name of its folder under /apps.

    Injector can be retrieved in two different ways:

    • by specifying injector / application name (getInjector(String injectorName)),
    • by specifying resource path for which an injector has been registered ( #getInjectorForResource(String resourcePath)).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      InjectorWithContext getInjector(String injectorName)
      Returns injector (with context) for specific application, or null if no such injector was registered.
      String getInjectorName(com.google.inject.Injector injector)
      Returns name of the given injector.
      String getInjectorNameForResource(String resourcePath)
      Returns injector name for specified resource path.
      Collection<String> getInjectorNames()
      Returns names of all registered injectors

    • Method Detail

      • getInjector

        InjectorWithContext getInjector(String injectorName)
        Returns injector (with context) for specific application, or null if no such injector was registered.
        Parameters:
        injectorName - name of required injector (same as application name)
        Returns:
        InjectorWithContext for given application
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if Slice is not running

      • getInjectorName

        String getInjectorName(com.google.inject.Injector injector)
        Returns name of the given injector.
        Parameters:
        injector -
        Returns:

      • getInjectorNames

        Collection<String> getInjectorNames()
        Returns names of all registered injectors
        Returns:

      • getInjectorNameForResource

        String getInjectorNameForResource(String resourcePath)
        Returns injector name for specified resource path. It looks for an injector name using "best match" approach, i.e. if there are two injectors registered, one for path "/apps/appname" and the other for path "/apps/appname/x" then for resourcePath "appname/x/(...)" it will return injector registered for "/apps/appname/x"; for resourcePath "appname/y/(...)" it will return injector registered for "/apps/appname". If no injector can be found for a given resourcePath, null is returned.
        Returns:
        injector name if found, null otherwise
